CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 22, 1950, pg. 2, reads: "COMMITTED TO THE ELEMENTS - The Fifth Ward Honor Roll at Weil School is rapidly deteriorating as is shown by this photo of it taken this week. The school board wants to tear it down, says that school children may get hurt.  The Sgt. Carney Post, Veterans of Foreign Wars, plans to sponsor a solicitation drive to raise $5,000 to build a new memorial of concrete or marble, with bronze tablets containing the names of servicemen set in it. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Fifth Ward Honor Roll Memorial in dilapidated condition in front of A. Leo Weil Elementary School on Centre Avenue, Hill District
